titles: Devastation after deadly flooding in DR Congo’s capital

title: Ukraine captures two Chinese nationals fighting for Russia
snippets: President Zelensky says two soldiers were captured while fighting in Ukraine's Donetsk region.
President Zelenskyy said Kyiv is demanding a response from Beijing after Chinese fighters found in the Donetsk region.
summary: President Zelensky reported that two soldiers were captured in Ukraine's Donetsk region amid ongoing conflicts. Additionally, Zelensky has called on Beijing for a response after Chinese fighters were discovered in the same area, indicating international involvement. Kyiv is actively seeking clarification and action from China regarding this situation.
titles: Ukraine captures two Chinese nationals fighting for Russia

title: West Virginia Mountaineers: Transfer 101: Brenen Lorient
snippets: The West Virginia basketball program has landed their second transfer addition of the off-season, and it comes from a player that Ross Hodge is plenty familiar with in North Texas forward Brenen Lorient.  Lorient, 6-foot-9, 215-pounds, is coming off a standout season with the Mean Green where he averaged 11.8 points, 4.9 rebounds and over 1.1 blocks per game across 24.8 minutes per game.  Lorient came to North Texas from Florida Atlantic where he spent two seasons where he appeared in 21 games as a reserve as a freshman and followed that up appearing in all 31 games while averaging 2.2 points and 1.3 rebounds per game before leaving for Denton.
summary: The West Virginia basketball program has secured their second off-season transfer with North Texas forward Brenen Lorient joining the team. Standing at 6-foot-9 and weighing 215 pounds, Lorient had an impressive season at North Texas, averaging 11.8 points, 4.9 rebounds, and over 1.1 blocks in 24.8 minutes per game. Prior to North Texas, he played two seasons at Florida Atlantic, appearing in 52 games and improving his performance before transferring to Denton. His move reunites him with coach Ross Hodge.
titles: West Virginia Mountaineers: Transfer 101: Brenen Lorient

title: Trump’s tariffs will damage the world
snippets: The trade deficits will remain roughly unchanged — the globe will just end up poorer
summary: Global trade deficits are projected to stay relatively stable, but this stability comes at a cost, as it will lead to a decrease in global wealth. This means that while the balance between imports and exports across countries may not see significant shifts, the overall economic prosperity worldwide is expected to decline.
titles: Trump’s tariffs will damage the world

title: Dave & Buster's Interim CEO Says Chain 'Unwinding' Past Mistakes
snippets:
Key Takeaways

  • Dave & Buster's interim CEO Kevin Sheehan said the company is working to fix past mistakes.
  • Sheehan said past leadership made "very dramatic and chaotic changes." CEO Chris Morris resigned from the gaming restaurant franchise in December to take over as CEO of the retail waxing franchise European Wax Center.
  • Fourth-quarter sales fell short of analysts' estimates.


Dave & Buster's (PLAY) new leadership is looking to correct mistakes made by past executives, interim CEO Kevin Sheehan said on the company's fourth-quarter earnings call.

In attempting "to improve the business that was already doing well, prior leadership made very dramatic and chaotic changes that, among other things, distracted, confused, and overwhelmed our customers and our operators," Sheehan said Monday, according to a transcript from AlphaSense.

The gaming restaurant franchise's previous CEO, Chris Morris, resigned from the top job in December to take over as CEO of the retail waxing franchise European Wax Center (EWCZ). Dave & Buster's shares have fallen 75% over the past year.

Sheehan said he and other new executives have been "systematically unwinding these mistakes and pursuing a back-to-basics strategy while making high-confidence improvements to the key areas of the business."

Q4 Revenue Comes in Shy of Expectation

The company reported fiscal 2024 fourth-quarter revenue of $534.5 million, down 11% year-over-year and below the $545.4 million expected by analysts polled by Visible Alpha. The company posted adjusted earnings per share (EPS) of $0.69, a penny above consensus.

Shares of Dave & Buster's were little changed in recent trading after initially surging Tuesday.
summary: Dave & Buster's interim CEO, Kevin Sheehan, announced efforts to correct previous leadership errors that led to dramatic and chaotic changes, negatively impacting the company and its customers. This comes after former CEO Chris Morris resigned in December to become CEO of European Wax Center. The company's fourth-quarter sales of $534.5 million fell short of the expected $545.4 million, although earnings per share were slightly above expectations at $0.69. Despite these efforts and financial results, Dave & Buster's shares have dropped 75% over the past year.
titles: Dave & Buster's Interim CEO Says Chain 'Unwinding' Past Mistakes

title: Smell-seeking drone uses moth antenna to follow a scent
snippets: A moth antenna can be integrated into the electronics of a drone to create a smell-seeking bio-hybrid – but it only detects the smell of a female moth
summary: Researchers have successfully integrated a moth antenna into drone electronics, creating a bio-hybrid device capable of detecting the specific scent of a female moth. This innovation marks a unique blend of biological components with technology, though its current application is limited to the identification of one particular smell.
titles: Smell-seeking drone uses moth antenna to follow a scent

title: Blood test predicts preeclampsia risk using RNA
snippets: A blood test can accurately predict whether someone without a known risk of preeclampsia is likely to develop the potentially fatal hypertensive pregnancy condition
summary: Researchers have developed a blood test that can accurately predict the likelihood of developing preeclampsia, a potentially fatal hypertensive condition during pregnancy, in individuals without previously known risk factors. This advancement offers a significant tool for early detection and preventive care in expectant mothers.
titles: Blood test predicts preeclampsia risk using RNA

title: How long is a day on Uranus? Slightly longer than we thought, it seems
snippets: Thanks to the Hubble Space Telescope, we now know that a day on Uranus lasts for 28 seconds longer than previously thought - a difference that could be crucial in planning future missions to the gas giant
summary: The Hubble Space Telescope has provided new data showing that a day on Uranus is 28 seconds longer than previously believed. This updated measurement is significant for the planning of future space missions to the gas giant.
titles: How long is a day on Uranus? Slightly longer than we thought, it seems

title: Trees capture toxic fingerprint of gold mining in the Amazon
snippets: Mercury pollution accumulating in trees could offer a new way to monitor destructive gold mining operations
summary: Scientists have discovered that mercury pollution, a byproduct of gold mining, is accumulating in trees. This finding offers a novel approach to track and monitor the environmental impact of gold mining operations by analyzing mercury levels in tree tissues.
titles: Trees capture toxic fingerprint of gold mining in the Amazon

title: Experimental medication helps treat cocaine addiction
snippets: A recently developed medication encourages people with cocaine use disorder to reduce their intake of the stimulant – a step towards the first approved drugs to treat the problem
summary: A new medication designed to help individuals with cocaine use disorder has shown promise in encouraging them to lower their cocaine intake. This development represents progress towards potentially the first approved drugs aimed at treating this specific disorder.
titles: Experimental medication helps treat cocaine addiction
